intro: Laportea jinganensis, commonly known as the Jing'an laportea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
